column4: Can someone explain to me why this doesn't work: "sudo cd some_directory"
It just says "cd: no such command
because cd isn't a command, it's a bash builtin

sudo runs one child process as root, and then the child process exits, leaving you where you were.  even if there was a cd command, it wouldn't do you any good, because the process which changed to a different directory would have died before you get to type your next command
